document.title: Content Standards and Grade Level Expectations English Program 2022

839E7353362A48089B1A139509692AB5.description: Accurately use a variety of social, academic, content-specific, and content area words and phrases. Gather vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

F0D6E86492DA4C7B9A4711EC84341140.description:
Accurately use a variety of social, academic, and content-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking,
and listening at the college and career-readiness level.

5A9D1D00FD794E0A9CC762E8F9FCC1FA.description: Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., refined, respectful, polite, diplomatic, condescending).

80CAEF2F7F7B43A28EEF671813B0C919.description: Interpret figures of speech (e.g., literary, biblical, and mythological allusions) in context.

000AF9C2630F47638D17103F703D8AA6.description: Correctly use synonyms, antonyms, and homographs appropriately to demonstrate meaning.

06DCD09F2EE9419CA3F05DA092D7DAA5.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and variation in word meanings.

6E0106400262434192638E4BDFB4717F.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and variation in word meanings.

3D64B69C9D4642A5AD11DE2FF1DC1902.description:
Consult both digital and print reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauri) to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of
speech.

10C89105B090453181D1356C81B65555.description: Use common Greek or Latin affixes and roots correctly (e.g., ex-, inter-, anti-, micro-).

DB1639AF73D440D991E63B517FD85CDD.description: Use context clues to help determine the meaning of a word or phrase.

115F721A87BD4C20B8D8140ED3246287.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on developmentally appropriate reading and content, choosing flexibly from a variety of strategies.

A3AE3B2999CF4FF7A2A2918289169C61.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and
consulting reference materials.

E88392EB7C6348A3BD971B2DD090EB35.description:
Choose language that expresses ideas clearly, recognizing subject-verb agreement and
eliminating wordiness and redundancy.

0E0D922ED8A34B28826D430AF8A6D590.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

A5DD57758FFD4E08ADAD426677BCE1FA.description:
Demonstrate understanding of how language functions in different contexts, making effective choices for meaning, style, and
comprehension.

3FC37A54BDF54C25A76D26A676A64373.description: Spell grade-appropriate words correctly consulting references as needed.

9F520C017E894D33956E3F279D5C4B2A.description:
Use punctuation to separate a series of adjectives (e.g., It was a fascinating, enjoyable
movie.).

87D4A9DE5DC24CFE88DF1C40F5294DA0.description: Demonstrate command of English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling conventions when writing.

D48BE5B7794F4A38B44AA4BC99F0AA5A.description: Apply appropriate English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling conventions.

31419C62E0964ED9801EA3D6A736FD4D.description:
Choose among simple, compound, complex, and compound-complex sentences when
speaking and writing.

9C48AFC91EDD4BAE9E8E0DF8D93D2265.description:
Produce complete sentences, recognizing and correcting inappropriate fragments and run-
ons.

97F04A8DFD0041378DD390C901AE8D61.description: Explain the function of phrases and clauses and correctly apply them.

1172CB23A2814EE8872DBB4898C20F28.description: Use conjunctions in writing and speech (e.g., and, but, for, nor, or, so).

4B7B527910DC4F56BEC09F36F9DD20B3.description: Apply knowledge of subject-verb agreement to write and speak effectively.

734E79FB75FF49AD9FD74A63432095BE.description:
Apply appropriate verb tenses to convey various times, sequences, states, and conditions.
Use linking and helping verbs.

57EFCAEA9C3F440E9B4A5D4CD6C9EFD8.description:
Use pronouns (including intensive pronouns) correctly and ensure that they are in the
proper case (subjective, objective, possessive).

E479F4EC8F4D4497B988258B28B686E9.description: Demonstrate command of English grammar and usage conventions.

E09935C3164F41D090A2E7C7DBB5FB18.description: Demonstrate command of English grammar and usage conventions.

258A9B52DB2D4F3BABA666D111896C07.description:
Write routinely for short and extended periods of time (e.g., time for research, reflection, and revision) for a variety of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences, including, but not limited to, narrative, persuasive,
and descriptive writing and knowledge of their qualities.

68BA3FB9E47F4B7298F361393327A08D.description: Write routinely over short and extended periods of time for a variety of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

5BA4FDBD42624BC6AF938E3FAC7E1116.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

D9378BDC1E8A4E44B626B1058685BA78.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

923DFBBA61F744B3BFFC0D243C4242B6.description: Assess the credibility and accuracy of each source.

341864C11B7341359013F93C1444131A.description:
Recall relevant information from experiences or gather relevant information from print and
digital sources using search terms effectively.

88A4A73E48FC48E5A8599C568A27541C.description:
Using multiple sources, participate in or conduct research to gather information that answers
questions about a single topic.

CAB6D34EAA2440EA99FBC41A109C028F.description:
As part of a research project, write a report using several sources, building knowledge through the investigation of
the different aspects of a topic.

A8F6D296759944C4960742F30F7D60D9.description: Conduct research projects of varying lengths based on focused questions to demonstrate understanding of the subject.

FC59A1F259734C9EBF3DDAF93FCE4655.description: Use technology, including the internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

56FF08A83B1C461EAC9C08FBDD6BED0B.description: Use technology, including the internet, to interact and collaborate with others and produce and publish writing.

D820386A199C415A82214D310F50C48F.description:
Focus on how well purpose and audience have been addressed, avoiding plagiarism, using
citations, according to style guides (e.g., MLA and APA student format).

5140F4ACC0184D2A8D4AAAFCDA861E45.description:
Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, drafting, revising, editing (using editing marks), rewriting,
and publishing.

CCA8B30747364D56B9BDC388884FF2F9.description:
Develop and strengthen writing as needed by using the writing process (planning, drafting, revising, editing, rewriting, and
publishing).

3B8F78767826462886C157C465938525.description:
Use literary elements like narrative structure, theme, mood, plot, setting, or moral to organize
and increase the length of writing.

274B835CBA4F47629186085D44174673.description: Write short essays, and literary texts that develop real or imagined experiences or events using transitional words, phrases, conjunctions, and other cohesive devices that improve writing organization in paragraphs of 5 or more sentences each.

4A38579042F9463AA0B6AFE555B27AF8.description: Write literary texts to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, details, and structure.

B49AC77B5BE24A399A3B78C159A2D096.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

8DABF9D2B3454E688B6FF12DC2764AE6.description: Use appropriate transitions to clarify relationships among ideas and concepts.

32C75008A3BB4744B2B5CF0C61DD6E95.description: Introduce a topic or thesis statement. Organize ideas, concepts, and information.

36C2B77C83CF423D8725A3FEA31EAF0A.description: Write informational texts to examine and analyze topics and convey ideas independently using appropriate text organization in a composition of 3 or more paragraphs of 5 or more sentences each.

6D1E5CAF12EE4E74941C40DA75D809D0.description:
Write informational texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the selection,
organization, and analysis of relevant content.

611341CC2AC14D0C80867A60987F2766.description: Use reliable sources to demonstrate understanding of the topic or text.

27F1A11886054528ACD1C6863A991FEB.description: Support claim(s) or counterarguments with logical reasoning and relevant evidence.

A11CBFD3B68D4611862A27A4E2C03E48.description: Express and clarify viewpoints and opinions. Take and defend positions.

9DE1AE1398534A68BFA5013EA221D8B5.description:
Justify opinions or persuade others by providing textual evidence or relevant background knowledge with moderate support on a variety of personal, social, and cultural topics and current events in a composition of 3 or
more paragraphs of 5 or more sentences each.

9786F4B26E5F4FD19DCFC4EB60FF62DF.description: Write arguments to support point of view using valid reasoning and relevant evidence.

00B1A380CEBF48C0B778FE007AEDCB89.description:
Read and comprehend a variety of literature (e.g., stories, dramas, and poetry) and informational texts (e.g.,
history, social studies, science, and technical texts) of appropriate complexity.

E243CDF2934743F3AFC93285C7FFCD71.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

8794FFAE848E46FEB2C0E2CCB4E8F28B.description:
Compare and contrast one author’s presentation of events with that of another (e.g., a memoir
written by and a biography on the same person) in informational texts.

DDE392BC0621429B845CF3D5D27E288C.description:
Compare and contrast literary texts in different forms or genres (e.g., stories and poems,
historical novels, and fantasy stories) in terms of their approaches to similar themes and topics.

03567389271A44DE865DB330EC22F153.description: Compare and contrast 2 or more authors’ presentations of similar themes or topics.

3F1571CC13C24D92BF56FA12DFF4021C.description:
Search for and evaluate the argument and specific evidence in a text, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not, including, but not limited to, narrative, persuasive, and descriptive
writing and knowledge of their qualities.

1AE404E3290B4D51A5CFC61069D125EC.description: Delineate and evaluate an author’s argument through evidence specified in a text.

9BB18A7FBD5F43FF8C0116542B55FC53.description:
Integrate information presented in different media or formats (e.g., visually [pictures, videos, etc.] data, [text or relevant information according to picture(s) presented]) and in words to develop a
coherent understanding of a topic or issue.

372773B1FBE44B0786A4562CAECB56F8.description:
Compare and contrast the experience of reading a story, drama, or poem with listening to or viewing an audio, video, or theatrical representation of a literary text. Contrast what the student sees and hears when reading the text with what the student perceives when listening or watching
with English subtitles.

91D06FC52CB94136B98177A20C88AF18.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats.

E091DDFA2A69460AA9ECB6A4067225F8.description:
Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in an informational text and explain how it is
conveyed.

27910DF5DF4A49E38AC8957C5F9C41B4.description:
Explain how an author develops the point of view of different characters, the narrator, or speaker
in a literary text.

BCDBA71B28BB4ADA9156D1143C49E35B.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

EE7E43F514A744BE88A4FC5EF5960FF0.description: Analyze how a particular sentence, paragraph, chapter, or section fits into the overall structure of an informational text and contributes to the development of the setting and ideas.

67006BE3666648F388CFCC58C09D1AA6.description:
Analyze how a particular sentence, chapter, scene, or poem fits into the overall structure of a literary text and contributes to the development of the theme, setting, plot, and elements of
poetry.

C21975694C9B4B658B3FF7AE52A47187.description:
Analyze the structure of a text, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., sections,
chapters, scenes, or stanzas) relate to each other and to the whole.

DB4DF5BA025746CD8DE47B559A0F1DDB.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in an informational text,
including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings.

01BEE0C2AAC846D5A5AA07CF0908B462.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a literary text, including figurative and connotative meanings. Analyze the impact of a specific word choice on
meaning and tone.

158054F4BBA846D48E2B74C1C3806673.description:
Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings. Analyze
how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

1D8C2ED457AC4791A9AD6366DDF772FA.description:
In detail, analyze how a key individual, event, or idea is introduced, illustrated, and developed
in an informational text (e.g., through examples or anecdotes).

31338428C4FA4B88B7F1D3BFC619AA95.description:
Describe how the plot or setting of a particular story or drama unfolds in a series of episodes
and how the characters respond or change as the plot moves toward a resolution.

F560BA1D53534C6A9D46D972D85FF798.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, or ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

E13EA2F2FF3647EB934535AB2B30448F.description:
Determine a main idea of an informational text and how it is conveyed through details.
Provide a summary of the text without personal opinions or judgments.

E568BDF07FD34F2589E96D3EFA4BCDBD.description: Provide a summary of the text without personal opinions or judgments.

7D5137A305524D908BE6DD404E4EA5C5.description:
Determine a theme or main idea of a literary text and how it is conveyed through particular
details.

30C708C926174761A04E38C7A93799B0.description: Determine main ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development. Summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

5F1EDCD534FE4C879B99C6692266C4B6.description: Identify facts/details that support main idea(s) from the texts.

77B12110E79F48C5BF0B336E415DFC87.description:
Read a variety of grade-level texts and view a variety multimedia resources (when available) to explain ideas,
facts, events, cultural identities, genres, and processes, supplying textual evidence and connections/relationships to support analyses, predictions, inferences and conclusions drawn from the text.

2B501B9AD48E408FBA0EE5248AFE6DBF.description: Read critically to make logical inferences and cite specific textual evidence to support conclusions drawn from the text.

929595817D3247BA9409E3AC450748DB.description:
Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as
necessary.

6777FE34EC164AF4BA30EBC4AE7FCBEF.description:
Accurately read on-level prose and poetry orally with appropriate rate and expression on
successive readings.

1A2C5F58C0554367970B0E852FCDD29D.description: Read on-level texts with purpose and understanding.

373A444FB8914D0B85230502CB75B36B.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

600C362E58C54E21A61A23A69CAAD720.description:
Process encoding sounds through letters (s,r), consonant blends (sh, sk), digraphs (ay, ew), or
trigraphs (sch, thr) using conventional spelling patterns to form words.

053A90852E304FB3B16C87E5E7E4E12D.description: Apply meaning to single units of sound in existing word parts to encode a given word.

4DBCC97A2FB8459FB30B825C495F99BA.description:
Accurately read multisyllabic words using a combined knowledge of all letter-sound
correspondences and syllabication patterns.

D875C7A5CEC448BC9F8E54CBCA8B4B3D.description:
Use a combined knowledge of strategies to decode grade-level monosyllabic and multisyllabic
words.

2D494919C2AC4E0DAB3961B944B9AFF2.description: Understand and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills to decode and encode words.

BE606B82AA8A44239EB1064E02F9241F.description: Refer to previous grades as needed to reinforce these skills.

8934D776238E44B1AC409590368252FE.description: Phonological awareness (rhyming, blending, segmentation, deletion, isolation, substitution)

FAB394060D36441C83D1D840BDE90305.description: Provide reference information of source(s) applying required MLA and APA student format.

9C23A978111F4F8A977B84381AE06E24.description:
Cite or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others avoiding plagiarism and following a
standard format for citation (e.g., MLA and APA student format).

43A300985B654903BA1F471B217DABAB.description: Recognize and gather relevant information from multiple reliable print and digital sources.

46887DC727CA4E888EDB06C7A058F942.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

1FE80F4F50B3434DBBCC00FA4D0C5476.description: Plan and deliver oral presentations on a variety of topics, citing specific textual evidence to support ideas (e.g., integrating print or technological/digital resources).

AC8F9311CF2A453AA993AD842D8C811D.description:
Plan and deliver different types of oral presentations/reports to express information and support ideas in social, academic,
college, and career settings.

5927CA88F4434F7CACE09C4542882A56.description: Adjust language choices according to purpose, task, and audience.

BE5A9848832B4CCA9A5062803D907950.description:
Make predictions and inferences and draw conclusions from listening to a variety of texts,
performances, and multimedia sources.

048C0FCA19B2461E8546A9DFA0C8F39A.description:
Describe, explain, and evaluate text, self, and real-world experiences. Express thoughts and opinions to discuss
current events, concepts, themes, characters, plot, and conflict resolution.

33363A3876624F9DABF4320061931CF1.description: Adjust language choices according to the task, context, purpose, and audience.

3AA01D79AC8140E3A9B23B88FBE2F021.description: Reach an agreement or persuade others in conversations using learned phrases and creative or original responses.

F930A57EBFC148868E27A62463A32F91.description: Provide, justify, and defend opinions or positions in speech.

054CE4E0A3DC4AF8B6D4A310841E9FA0.description: Use a growing set of academic words, content-specific words, synonyms, and antonyms to tell, retell, explain, and analyze stories and experiences with increasing precision and understanding of differences in meaning.

3AFB41FCF0BF402AA9A28ACBF0849897.description: Contribute to social, academic, college, and career conversations using accurate and appropriate language.

F261455147304B8F8B840D04D91F2472.description: Describe, explain, support, discuss, and synthesize information.

C8DB5832B9C044A9BE7C3B18AF5A406A.description: Memorize, analyze, and follow increasingly complex instructions and directions.

17EC269694E447EC9FB476557FB799CA.description: Formulate and answer closed- and open-ended questions.

DF91265B2D7A40F1AB69036872D48558.description: Evaluate information and determine appropriate responses to answer questions effectively.

4A58CD9185C248B98D5BCE06D0EBF5BF.description:
Contribute to class, group, and partner discussions by taking turns, asking relevant questions, concurring with others, adding relevant information, and paraphrasing key ideas from read texts or
presentations/discussions/performances.

13B1324B190B4D0E9C6308068704584C.description:
Contribute to discussions on a variety of social, academic, college, and career topics in diverse contexts and with different
audiences.

61DC8EB5484F4F78B7CC37B2B800DDAE.description: Listen to, respond to, and analyze complex instructions and statements.

658EA7F347FB443783515D527FC7900E.description:
Listen and respond during a read-aloud from a variety of fiction and nonfiction texts, showing comprehension, generalizing, relating to character and setting, and making connections from
personal experience.

8BCC3006FE884681BA2C59504F486C7A.description: Take turns and show consideration by concurring with others in discussions.

ABF29D98C32542A0A5804C9177565343.description: Ask relevant questions, add relevant information, and paraphrase key ideas.

CBFABA13951145D1A7B4BC4EB0443024.description: Listen to and collaborate with peers during social and academic interactions in class, group, and partner discussions; read-alouds; oral presentations; and a variety of grade-appropriate topics.

E8064AB657FC463AA5F17101C92D54EA.description:
Comprehend and analyze information from a variety of listening activities to ask and answer questions on social, academic,
college, and career topics.
